I've always had a warm spot in my heart for this strategy. ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f60d.png?v=15.1)  
  
The longer I trade the more interested I become in avoiding losses. I don't think you can do that with a screen full of indicators though.   
  
The way I see this system logic is that you are trying to determine the direction of the swing by using the slower stochs and then entering on a pullback. In other words, finding a lower-risk entry point.   
  
The more you can catch a move that is going in the direction of the longer-term trend the more profit you should make and the better your R/R should be overall. The longer term trend is where the money is imho.  
  
By the way, Melpheos is on my short list of guys to trust in this business.   
  
Thank you, Melpheos. Keep us posted on your new system.   
  
  
Great success to you!

Hi Lyra, as I explained earlier, you will have more winners and less losers if you are trading **with the trend**.  
  
There is no way to be sure that you will have a winner when you place a trade with this or any other system. The best you can hope for is to put the odds in your favor. The best way to do that is to trade in the direction that price is tending to go anyway.   
  
When you look at the 4h chart of this pair that I have attached below you will see clearly that the pair has put in a double bottom on June 30 and July 1 then continued on the uptrend it has been on since the middle of March. It looks to me like this was just a retracement to the uptrend line.  
  
The lime colored vertical line is about the time you entered the trade you mention. The gold line is showing a strong uptrend. And the bold violet line drawn across the double bottom is likely to be strong support. Unless this pair trades below that line I would still consider the trend to be up and take only long trades. Also notice that the slow stochs on the 4h are sloping upward which is another good sign here that the trend is still up.  
  
My point is that you should always be aware of the trend at least on the next higher timeframe and it will help you avoid being on the wrong side of a lot of trades.   
  
Hope this helps you to more profitable trades.  
pd

it was 11 hours ago so is not actuall but ....  
  
1) make sure sts on higher timeframes are in trend u want to follow.  
[ i trade on 1D , 4H and 1H , it means : first i check 1D looking for trend  
tips , later i try to find good setup on 4H , and then look at 1h to open]  
  
If you trade on 5min , first u should check 1h , then 15min and open when 5min is in good setup (follow setups on 1h and 15min)  
  
Using higher TF (timeframes) u get more probability to success.  
  
U should not trade using sts without checking daily trend (1D , 4H )  
It is too risky ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f641.png?v=15.1)  
  
I would not trade setup which u post.  
It wasnt enough good setup for me.

In this case, the trend is down. That upward retracement is like an elastic band being pulled back waiting to be released. When the 5.3.3 stochs went down and passed 80 level, release the stretched rubber or short the currency.

OK, I have these questions for you:  
  
look to longer time frames for confirmation. If I'm trading 15, the one hour should be in the same direction? What I found happening to me is this: 15 was good 5,3,3 overbought/oversold opposite the 20 and 50 (either they were trending away from the 5,3,3 or pasted up in the margins) so that when the 5 crossed over, I went in. Unfortunately, the 1 and 5 may not have been with me at that moment. So I would immediately lose the spread plus 10+ pips and sometimes get stopped out. What I was trying to do was come up with a relatively sure fire way to nab 10 pips at a time so that I can trade multiple lots and really make a living at this. So either: 15 min is too whipsawy anyway or my stops are too tight or I should trade 1H with larger stops and take a valium for any drawdowns before it moves in the direction of the longer trend. I hope this makes sense.  
  
Also the "magenta" stoch was a MTF 5 minute 5,3,3 stoch overlayed on the boxing indicator of the 5, 20, and 50 of the current time frame. So I though that if my green 5 crossed over and the 20 and 50 confirmed the trend that I would peek at the MTF 5M 5 to make sure it wasn't overbought/oversold in the OPPOSITE direction just at the moment I pulled the trigger, cause that would mean an instant drawdown of several pips over the spread. I hate that!

ok , lets work a little bit   
im sorry i did not write it earlier (after dinner) but i went with my friends to play soccer.  
Did not play like 3 months and ii was getting tired so fast and regulary ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f609.png?v=15.1)  
  
I mostly use 2 settings of sts.  
1)4,2,2 and 20,2,10 (got this settings from melpheos, this guy brought here , in this thread a lot of wonderfull job and gave us a lot of good paths)  
2)my 2nd settings are :5,3,3 and 35,10,10  
  
right now for me is doesnt matter which i use , i know sts very well and like them a lot.they are easy to use.  
When u will use them longer time u will feel same i do   
  
My "strategy" :  
i look at 1week and 1Day ; it gives me view of trend (long trend , i very often keep positions during whole day or even week or 2weeks)  
I dont use SL and TP (maybe it is not good idea and im not supposed to share this informations but i dont use it)  
when i keep positions during whole days , somethimes i have -50p or even -200p and after day or few days i got +200 or +400pips.  
But i see on 1week or 1D chart that it will go in my direction.  
It makes trading stressless and profitable   
  
for me is important trend! i never trade agains that.  
sometimes i dont open new positions day or 2 because i dont see enough good setup.  
Dont like to risk and loss. so i keep no trading , but later when i see good setup i got much more pips so it is good recompensate for not trading days   
  
So when i know trend (slow sts are very CLEAR pointing up or down and same is fast sts on 1Week and 1D) im looking for fast sts on 4h and 1h.  
and this is my entry.  
Very often when i open positions it was retracement , and in hour or a few hours i got -50 or -100pips , i draw fibo on 4h or 1h and check when is hi probably retracement to end , and try to open new position like before.  
This gives me 2 times more pips and bigger chance to not get loss.  
because if it not drop to make my first positions in profit i will get profit from second positions (it very often recompense loss from 1st positions)  
and i can close 1st with small loss and 2nd with bigger profit.  
Or if i was right i got profit from both positions [mostly very big profit]  
and it is worth risk   
  
uffff i wonder if somebody will read it , hope it is not boring.  
sorry for my english , im just polish ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f601.png?v=15.1)  
  
if u have more questions just ask i will try to answer.  
  
  
atachments :  
some actuall examples - makret is closed.  
1D is clear DOWN , 4h is getting nice setup.  
_[ i checked 1week and 1month too , there i see : 1month great down trend , and broken up trend on 1week - no need of more confirmations]_  
i know weekend can bring some changes , but i know it is strond down trend.  
i opened sell positions.  
even when market will open and i will get -100p I belive it will go down.  
sometimes we need to wait to get profit so this is reason i dont use SL and TP.  
I close positions when i get profit i like [which is enough for me]  
  
sometimes i trade on 5 pairs.  
1st i close with -200p because market went in wrong way and im sure it will not return ,   
but 4 other positions i close with +600p or more.  
overall im in nice profit ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f601.png?v=15.1)  
im not afroid to close lossing positions when i see it is nothing i can do with it  
but i use high TF it is rare to not be profitable after a few days   
i remember pair i had -600p and did not close it , after week i got +300p.  
i just opened in wrong time but i was sure it will go where it was poiting to.

After reading through the entire thread and looking at all the different indicators i decided to only trade based on the original settings (on page 1) that were set by boxingislife. i backtested the last 3 months on GBPUSD ONLY and it has around a 75% success rate based on the last 3 months (i will backtest it more). But if it is highly successful in a volatile economic climate and is also successful in a good economic climate such as 2007 (when the thread started) it really shows an adaptive system. i was surprised that it wasn't rated 5 stars.  
  
Here are the rules i trade this system on:  
Only take perfect/good setups as stated in the beginning, on 15M time frame (because i have time to look at charts)  
  
Take Profit : 30 pips (after 20 pips, move stop loss to breakeven)  
Stop loss : 40 pips  
  
you guys might think that this is a bad reward/risk ratio, but it seems to work well on this system due to high rates of success, this method paid out on average 500 pips a month only on GBPUSD. ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f911.png?v=15.1)

Success with any strategy, including this one...involves the right psychology. If you follow the rules 100%, you will be in profit. Here is some maths. Say this method had 60% success rate.  
  
(Therefore, hypothetically)  
10 Trades  
6 x 30 pips = 180 pips  
4 x 40 pips = 160 pips  
  
180 -160 pips = 20 pips profit.  
  
with 70% success rate (as it has achieved over this so far this year)  
  
7 x 30 pips = 210 pips  
3 x 40 pips = 120 pips  
  
210 - 120 pips = 90 pips profit.  
  
Consistency is in the mind.

hi guys, i've finally done the results!  
  
OK first i must say that this took me a long time to do, atleast a gud 5-10 hours.   
  
The results are for the 15 minute timeframe, the 1 hour timeframe and the 5 minute timeframe....the results are very very good, with really good returns, before u trade this system tho u shud do some sort of practice or forward testing because u have to be familiar with valid setups, after doing so much backtesting i have familiarized myself with this system.  
  
This is a perfect example of a system that will give u an edge over the market, it is up to you how u manage your psychology in order to make this as profitable as it can be.  
  
many thanks to boxingislife for creating this method, it could pay off for many years to come.   
  
The rules of the trades are within the spreadsheet however there is some discretion in this system and at the end of the day it will give results based on how u trade it, the backtest is based on taking perfect trades of the system.  
  
good luck guys!! i hope u make many pips  
  
p.s i am going to start trading this method like a robot from 2day onwards and will post some chart examples and also whether my account is growing or not.  
  
pipping

market was moving sideways, opened a position as signaled and the market was close to my stop but it never hit, took the opportunity to close the position with +12 pips to end the week.  
  
I used to previously analyze MTF but now with this method i've just been trading it on a single time frame, its powerful enough to do that. this was my last trade of the session, I went to bed soon after the entry. price had moved quite a bit during the last two sessions and now needed another breakout above the R2 pivot. I thought that was unlikely on a friday. It was a low probability trade from my perspective  
Why did I take a low probability trade?  
1\. It was a valid set up  
2\. who am I to call the probability of a set up?  
3\. I have excellent profits from 8 consequetive wins  
4\. I can protect my gains using Money Management  
5\. I wanted to show the system can lose  
6\. Trading is not about being right  
  
The losing trade is highlighted in blue. Notice the size of the loss compared to the recent winners. There is no need to be GREEDY, I didnt need any more profit. I didnt like the trade so I only risked a small amount on it. Using money management I was able to overcome FEAR and pull the trigger on a valid set up, knowing it wasnt going to hurt me. Understanding this is more important than any other aspect of trading  
I had a lucky run, The market broke out and trended up and I was able to ride it using this trending system. I trade conservatively and safely because I know the market is completely unpredictable and each of those entries could easily have been losers. If so - I would have preserved 95% of my account and been ready for the good times returning. Win or lose, it was good trading and that is all that counts  
nah..zip..ahh.. ALL THAT COUNTS!

The best advice i give to anyone counting in pips is : count in %age of equity.  
  
For instance i have a trade right now up around 100 pips. One would say, whoa great trade. But if i have taken this trade with a 2% risk and 40 pips SL you can see that my equity is up 5%. If i have taken this trade with 1% risk and 100 pips SL, my equity is up 1%.  
  
But if i have take this trade with 10% and 25 pips SL, my equity is up 40%.  
  
As you can see, the pip count does not mean anything ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f609.png?v=15.1)

Is anyone still following this thread?  
  
I'm in the process of reading from the beginning, I got up to page 30 in about 2 nights! A lot of reading!! ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f914.png?v=15.1)  
  
First off, a big thanks to boxingislife for sharing his method! I've been using stochastics on a MTF setup for a while but never considered adding longer stochs on the same chart for confirmation.  
  
I am working on the following setup, and would like your views: (for shorts):  
  
1) Wait for the 60min stoch 5-3-3 to cross down, preferably from the O/S or O/B area.  
  
2) Wait for the 5min stoch to pull back up, and take the next stoch signal down.  
  
I use 13 pips SL (keeping it tight) and 26pips TP, for a 2:1 reward to risk.  
  
I attach a potential setup to give you an idea of what I am talking about. This hasn't followed through, for now, but it's probably because the market is sideways today due to NFP later in the day.

Just a couple quick comments. First, I think Jimmer actually came up with the "slingshot" setup. It was using a longer term sto for "trend", and shorter term to highlite the pullback against that "trend", and visually it looked like a slingshot being pulled back. Buffy uses the same idea, but with a slightly different sto as long term, with 3 short term stos to form "ribbons" (but they give the same visual). And btw, Buffy is a she! lol   
  
You have put together a nice combination, and as you say, just wait for the best setups as there will be plenty to scalp on a daily basis. This approach has the advantage of effectively seeing multiple TFs because of the use of longer term stos combined with short term stos. Having spent several years in Buffys "room", I know there is value in the approach she teaches. Looks like youve applied the theory nicely. I will be taking a close look at what youre doing. Keep up the good work.  
  
Ninja

I responded like he had just posted it. lol Im sure my comments had been previously made by someone somewhere within the 50+ pages of posts since his original post. lol  
  
I thought Id share some thoughts on how this approach could be utilized for scalping a steady income daily. Using his tools, and throwing in a couple add'l "trend" tools, I have outlined how one might plan his/her trades each day, and the criteria necessary to take the trades. Ive outlined the criteria on the initial chart, with some add'l observations among the 3 charts.   
  
I would focus solely on these setups, and would typically put on at least a 2lot position, looking to take 1 off and 5 pips, 2nd at 10. If trading a 3lot based position, I would take 1 off at 5, 7, 9or10 as an example. Some might wish to trail on last as early entries may run for a notable distance. I prefer to hit targets, but thats my nature.  
  
With patience to wait for the criteria to be met, I think you will see the potential of this methodology. The 3 charts I have posted only cover about 2 1/2 hrs of trading, so you can imagine what may be possible each day.   
  
I provided some ideas on entry to go with the setups. Ive not had a chance to go thru the thread yet, so I hope to find some add'l insights that could further enhance what Ive shown. As always, would love to have comments, observations, etc.

I mentioned previously that entries might be "tightened" by dropping down in TF. The charts Ive attached show the setup chart as well as a 3 multiple lower TF chart to highlite possible entries. Ive used a short term RSI to highlite these. The explanation is on the low TF chart.   
  
Please understand that Ive made this a bit sensitive on purpose. Personally, this is how I will utilize the slingshot methodology as I like the immediate response time and tightness of entries. If the TFs selected here are a bit "short" for you, simply raise them both by some multiple which better fits you. Of course, likely fewer setups will occur each day, but the ones that do should provide larger moves accordingly. This is the trade-off.   
  
Ive offered this simply as something to try out. Whether you use these specific tools is not important as much as the underlying methodology of essentially selling rallies in a downtrend and buying dips in an uptrend.   
Nothing new here, just another way to get there. :-)  
  
As always, comments welcome.

My primary trading approach deals with pullbacks following Macd crosses and 1-2-3 setups. I have added Boxingislife's mutliSto to this for add'l setup opportunities. Something I learned with the "slingshot" type setups is that they will often manifest themselves in conjunction with the Macd pulling back after crossing the midline and/or with the pt 3 of a 1-2-3. Thus, its a logical addition to my trading templates. Ive attached a chart of my main TF, and have highlited 3 setups where the methods are nicely confluent with each other. I hope you find the insights beneficial in some way.  
  
By simply adding the Macd to your charts, this crossing may help to alert you of possible setups coming on the multiStos. If you find this of interest, throw it on your charts and look back to see if you find it beneficial. I use an 8/18/8 Macd, but nothing magic here. Try your favorite or just use the standard 12/26/9 for assessing.   
  
The chart Ive attached is actually my low TF (with the Macd/MultiStos). I also have 2 higher TFs (each a 3 multiple higher of the prev). This gives me a nice perspective that approximates a 5min up to nearly a 60min horizon for setups. As Boxingislife stated in his initial post, just wait until you have prime setups, and you can simply ignore the rest! As you can see from my chart, there's no shortage of them. Some will be so-so, some will be beginnings of large trends. With the higher TF setups, you can use the lower TF charts to tighten entries if desired. At some point, you will undoubtedly see a setup on the low TF that starts a move large enough to trigger a setup on the next TF, which may run far enough to trigger a move on the next. Conversely, given a pullback setup on the highest TF, once it starts, a small pullback there may be a setup on the next lower TF, etc. Actually, I know of one of these recently, and I'll add the chart to highlite this for reference.   
  
Good trading

Hopefully, Ive placed my stop where I know the trade has gone wrong, so until it hits it, any movement against me is within my wiggle room. I normally will give price once to run against me, but not twice. Once the trade is moving in my favor, I move to BE. I can always reenter if stop is hit. My targets tend to fall within a range of 10-20+ pips, so if I get to 5/6 pips in my favor, Im moving my stop. There are plenty of setups available, and the good ones dont generally cause the problems. I hope this addresses your questions.

I've coded an indicator which some of you might find useful trading this method. It basically alerts you when:  
  
The 4H, 30M & 5M are all above the 50 level & when the 1M time frame is below the 20 level for a long trade.   
  
Or  
  
The 4H, 30M & 5M are all below the 50 level & when the 1M time frame is above the 80 level for a long trade.   
  
The indicator works perfectly, However I am looking for someone you could possibly insert a few more lines of code so when the long parameters are met an upwards arrow is shown on the chat and when the short parameters are met a downwards arrow is shown on the chart. I work be extremely grateful if someone could help me with this. I've spent hours trying but do not know enough about programming to be able to achieve this! ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f641.png?v=15.1)   
  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
//| Stochs_4H_30M_5M_1M.mq4   
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
  
#property copyright ""  
  
#property indicator_chart_window  
  
datetime lastbar;  
bool EmailSent;  
  
extern bool EmailAlert;  
extern bool SoundON;  
extern double highlimit = 80;  
extern double midlimit = 50;  
extern double lowlimit = 20;  
  
  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
//| Custom indicator initialization function |  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
int init()  
{  
//---- indicators  
  
Comment ("Stochastic +/- 80/20 Signal Indicator ON");  
  
//----  
return(0);  
}  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
//| Custom indicator deinitialization function |  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
int deinit()  
{  
//----  
  
Comment ("");  
  
//----  
return(0);  
}  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
//| Custom indicator iteration function |  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+  
int start()  
{  
int counted_bars=IndicatorCounted();  
//----  
  
double main_M1 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M1,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_MAIN,0);  
double signal_M1 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M1,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_SIGNAL,0);  
  
double main_M5 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M5,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_MAIN,0);  
double signal_M5 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M5,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_SIGNAL,0);  
  
double main_M30 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M30,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_MAIN,0);  
double signal_M30 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_M30,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_SIGNAL,0);  
  
double main_H4 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_H4,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_MAIN,0);  
double signal_H4 = iStochastic(NULL,PERIOD_H4,5,1,3,MODE_SMA,0,MODE_SIGNAL,0);  
  
datetime curbar = Time[0];  
if (lastbar != curbar)  
{  
lastbar = curbar;  
if ((main_H4 < midlimit) && (main_M30 < midlimit) && (main_M5 < midlimit) && (main_M1 > highlimit))  
if ((signal_H4 < midlimit) && (signal_M30 < midlimit) && (signal_M5 < midlimit) && (signal_M1 > highlimit))  
{  
Alert ("Short Entry Warning On ",Symbol()," ",Period()," min");  
if (EmailAlert && !EmailSent)   
{  
SendMail("Short","Short Entry Warning On " + (StringConcatenate(Symbol()," ",Period())));  
EmailSent = true;  
}  
if (SoundON == true) PlaySound ("alert2.wav");  
}  
  
if ((main_H4 > midlimit) && (main_M30 > midlimit) && (main_M5 > midlimit) && (main_M1 < lowlimit))  
if ((signal_H4 > midlimit) && (signal_M30 > midlimit) && (signal_M5 > midlimit) && (signal_M1 < lowlimit))  
{  
Alert ("Long Entry Warning On ",Symbol()," ",Period()," min");  
if (EmailAlert && !EmailSent)   
{  
SendMail("Long","Long Entry Warning On " + (StringConcatenate(Symbol()," ",Period())));  
EmailSent = true;  
}  
if (SoundON == true) PlaySound ("alert2.wav");  
}   
}  
//----  
return(0);  
}  
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

Hi There,  
  
I quite like the signals I was getting from this sexy stochastic system.  
  
Found it frustrating to find pairs giving signals.  
  
So I built a very simple scanning script that I would like to share with any one who would like to try it out.  
  
It scans 19 pairs from M1 to D1 time frames - all selected by external parameter.  
  
I set the default to only report for H1 H4 and D1 time frames.  
  
Save this ex4 file under \expert\script folder and restart your meta.  
  
You can now run the scanner script any time you like and it will alert you to the pairs and time frames that are presenting sexy stoch signals.  
  
Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.  
  
It is obviously better running this at London open and New York Open times. I use stop orders and set SL and TP and forget about it!  
  
I also include my template file if you wish to use it.

Hi there, I like the sexy system too. I was lucky enough to even chat with boxinglife, the creator of this thread. It's a very simple system, but you must consider price action (candle formation) and support and resistance lines in order to trade this with the odds in your favor. The very first pages of this thraed are all you need to understand the basics. As boxingislife told us, it is better to wait for the perfect set ups and use larger time frames. You can use the 4h or 8H to see the big picture and then trade 15m or 30m with de set ups that match the larger time frame context. Other thing you can do to avoid unnecesary headaches is to set up the stochastics calculations with "close to close price" and never make a trade if there is no cross of the 20-80 levels.  
  
I ony use 2 stochs, the third was optional and it can be set off. Stochs are 5,3,3 red and 15,20,10 blue and this is the 4h for gold. As you can see, the Fast stoch (red) show more relaible behavoir. Hope this help. I will share more of my version but I think I will open a new thread in order to respect the original system and to avoid confussion.  
  
Give to this system a chance, it will teach you a lot about forex, futures and stochs.

This is another good example of sexy stochs set ups with the NZDUSD.  
  
I set up the sell limit order on sunday afternoon, My expectation was that fast stoch would cross the slow stoch and make a big correction. As it can be seen, I was right in the price level, but wrong in the tme of the entry. Nevertheless I managed my trade and grabed 60 (or 600, depending if youcount the fractional pips) with the 50% of the position, and after I moved my SL to secured 50 pips (or 500) wiht the rest when I saw price was resting 0.76500 area.  
  
The price reversed and hit the SL. I share the picture I was seen at the moment, so now it can be compare to actual chart and see that the correction happen but next day. And the lesson here is: you can be right in the price level, but wrong in the time. And you can be right in the time but wrong in the price level. But with good trade managment and a bit of luck, you can graab some pips. By the time the correction happend I was worry about my mistake and I let the down swing go. This happens a lot, but it is the bred and butter of trading forex.  
  
Hope this help
